page.title: 06BARLASTON TRANSPORT
page.content: Transport services to the village are served by British Rail with a station in the village.This is the main London to Manchester line with 80-100 trains a day-60% passenger 40% freight.During 1985 new automatic barriers were fitted on the level crossing the signal box was removed and the gate keepers house has become derelict. The village also has a bus service operated by the Potteries Motor Traction company into Longton and connecting to the potteries and Stafford. The Trent and Mersey canal passes through the village offering recreational and tourist amenities with pleasure craft and fishermen making full use of it.The tow path is used by walkers.
